verses.verse: James, <S%G2385><s%> a servant <S%G1401><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> and of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ, <S%G5547><s%> to the twelve <S%G1427><s%> tribes <S%G5443><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> are scattered <S%G1290><s%> abroad, <S%G1290><s%> greeting. <S%G5463><s%>
My brothers, <S%G80><s%> count <S%G2233><s%> it all <S%G3956><s%> joy <S%G5479><s%> when <S%G3752><s%> you fall <S%G4045><s%> into divers <S%G4164><s%> temptations; <S%G3986><s%>
Knowing <S%G1097><s%> this, that the trying <S%G1383><s%> of your <S%G5216><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> works <S%G2716><s%> patience. <S%G5281><s%>

But let patience <S%G5281><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> her perfect <S%G5046><s%> work, <S%G2041><s%> that you may be perfect <S%G5046><s%> and entire, <S%G3648><s%> wanting <S%G3007><s%> nothing. <S%G3367><s%>

If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> of you lack <S%G3007><s%> wisdom, <S%G4678><s%> let him ask <S%G154><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> that gives <S%G1325><s%> to all <S%G3956><s%> men liberally, <S%G574><s%> and upbraides <S%G3679><s%> not; and it shall be given <S%G1325><s%> him.

But let him ask <S%G154><s%> in faith, <S%G4102><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> wavering. <S%G1252><s%> For he that wavers <S%G1252><s%> is like <S%G1503><s%> a wave <S%G2830><s%> of the sea <S%G2281><s%> driven <S%G416><s%> with the wind <S%G416><s%> and tossed. <S%G4494><s%>
For let not that man <S%G444><s%> think <S%G3633><s%> that he shall receive <S%G2983><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> thing of the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>
A double <S%G1374><s%> minded <S%G1374><s%> man <S%G435><s%> is unstable <S%G182><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> his ways. <S%G3598><s%>
Let the brother <S%G80><s%> of low <S%G5011><s%> degree <S%G5011><s%> rejoice <S%G2744><s%> in that he is exalted: <S%G5311><s%>
But the rich, <S%G4145><s%> in that he is made <S%G5014><s%> low: <S%G5014><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> as the flower <S%G438><s%> of the grass <S%G5528><s%> he shall pass <S%G3928><s%> away.

For the sun <S%G2246><s%> is no sooner risen <S%G393><s%> with a burning <S%G2742><s%> heat, <S%G2742><s%> but it wither <S%G3583><s%> the grass, <S%G5528><s%> and the flower <S%G438><s%> thereof <S%G846><s%> falls, <S%G1601><s%> and the grace <S%G2143><s%> of the fashion <S%G4383><s%> of it perishes: <S%G622><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> shall the rich <S%G4145><s%> man fade <S%G3133><s%> away in his ways. <S%G4197><s%>

Blessed <S%G3107><s%> is the man <S%G435><s%> that endures <S%G5278><s%> temptation: <S%G3986><s%> for when he is tried, <S%G1384><s%> he shall receive <S%G2983><s%> the crown <S%G4735><s%> of life, <S%G2222><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> has promised <S%G1861><s%> to them that love <S%G25><s%> him.

Let no <S%G3367><s%> man <S%G3367><s%> say <S%G3004><s%> when he is tempted, <S%G3985><s%> I am tempted <S%G3985><s%> of God: <S%G2316><s%> for God <S%G2316><s%> cannot <S%G551><s%> be tempted <S%G551><s%> with evil, <S%G2556><s%> neither <S%G2582><s%> <S%G3762><s%> tempts <S%G3985><s%> he any <S%G3762><s%> man: <S%G3762><s%>
But every <S%G1538><s%> man is tempted, <S%G3985><s%> when he is drawn <S%G1828><s%> away of his own <S%G2398><s%> lust, <S%G1939><s%> and enticed. <S%G1185><s%>

Then <S%G1534><s%> when lust <S%G1939><s%> has conceived, <S%G4815><s%> it brings <S%G616><s%> forth <S%G616><s%> sin: <S%G266><s%> and sin, <S%G266><s%> when it is finished, <S%G658><s%> brings <S%G5088><s%> forth <S%G5088><s%> death. <S%G2288><s%>
Do not err, <S%G4105><s%> my beloved <S%G27><s%> brothers. <S%G80><s%>

Every <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> gift <S%G1394><s%> and every <S%G3956><s%> perfect <S%G5046><s%> gift <S%G1394><s%> is from above, <S%G509><s%> and comes <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> from the Father <S%G3962><s%> of lights, <S%G5457><s%> with whom <S%G3739><s%> is no <S%G3756><s%> ficklenss, <S%G3883><s%> neither <S%G2228><s%> shadow <S%G644><s%> of turning. <S%G5157><s%>

Of his own will <S%G1014><s%> begat <S%G616><s%> he us with the word <S%G3056><s%> of truth, <S%G225><s%> that we should be a kind <S%G5100><s%> of first fruits <S%G536><s%> of his creatures. <S%G2938><s%>

Why, <S%G5620><s%> my beloved <S%G27><s%> brothers, <S%G80><s%> let every <S%G3956><s%> man <S%G444><s%> be swift <S%G5036><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> slow <S%G1021><s%> to speak, <S%G2980><s%> slow <S%G1021><s%> to wrath: <S%G3709><s%>
For the wrath <S%G3709><s%> of man <S%G435><s%> works <S%G2716><s%> not the righteousness <S%G1343><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

Why <S%G1352><s%> lay <S%G659><s%> apart <S%G659><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> filthiness <S%G4507><s%> and superfluity <S%G4050><s%> of naughtiness, <S%G2549><s%> and receive <S%G1209><s%> with meekness <S%G4240><s%> the engrafted <S%G1721><s%> word, <S%G3056><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> is able <S%G1410><s%> to save <S%G4982><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> souls. <S%G5590><s%>
But be you doers <S%G4163><s%> of the word, <S%G3056><s%> and not hearers <S%G202><s%> only, <S%G3440><s%> deceiving <S%G3884><s%> your <S%G1438><s%> own selves. <S%G846><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> be a hearer <S%G202><s%> of the word, <S%G3056><s%> and not a doer, <S%G4163><s%> he is like <S%G1503><s%> to a man <S%G435><s%> beholding <S%G2657><s%> his natural <S%G1078><s%> face <S%G4383><s%> in a glass: <S%G2072><s%>

For he beholds <S%G2657><s%> himself, <S%G1438><s%> and goes <S%G565><s%> his way, <S%G1624><s%> and straightway <S%G2112><s%> forgets <S%G1950><s%> what <S%G3697><s%> manner <S%G3697><s%> of man he was.

But whoever <S%G3588><s%> looks <S%G3879><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the perfect <S%G5046><s%> law <S%G3551><s%> of liberty, <S%G1657><s%> and continues <S%G3887><s%> therein, he being <S%G1096><s%> not a forgetful <S%G1953><s%> hearer, <S%G202><s%> but a doer <S%G4163><s%> of the work, <S%G2041><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> man shall be blessed <S%G3107><s%> in his deed. <S%G4162><s%>

If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> man among <S%G1722><s%> you seem <S%G1380><s%> to be religious, <S%G2357><s%> and bridles <S%G5468><s%> not his tongue, <S%G1100><s%> but deceives <S%G538><s%> his own <S%G848><s%> heart, <S%G2588><s%> this <S%G5127><s%> man's religion <S%G2356><s%> is vain. <S%G3152><s%>

Pure <S%G2513><s%> religion <S%G2356><s%> and undefiled <S%G283><s%> before <S%G3844><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> and the Father <S%G3962><s%> is this, <S%G3778><s%> To visit <S%G1980><s%> the fatherless <S%G3737><s%> and widows <S%G5503><s%> in their affliction, <S%G2347><s%> and to keep <S%G5083><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> unspotted <S%G784><s%> from the world. <S%G2889><s%>
